intro: Erigeron calvus, commonly known as the hairless fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Erigeron calvus is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
